kawigi.widget
Class Category

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.AbstractButton
                  javax.swing.JMenuItem
                      javax.swing.JMenu
                          kawigi.widget.Category
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.MenuElement, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class Category
extends javax.swing.JMenu
implements javax.swing.MenuElement

Adapted from KawigiEdit 1's kawigi.snippet.Category. This is a control that subclasses JMenu and has some additional features for categories. Honestly, some of this functionality could be moved to somewhere else and we could get rid of this class altogether, but it's already written, so why bother?

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Category

public Category(java.lang.String name)
Creates a Category with the given name. If the name is "", then this is the root category (and the label is set to be "Snippets").

Category

public Category()
Default constructor for a Category. This is required to read the Category from disk or to just create a root category.

Method Detail

add

public void add(Snippet s,
                java.lang.String cat)
Adds a Snippet to this category with the given subcategory. If cat is empty, the snippet is added to this category. If cat is non-empty, it will find the first subcategory in cat and create it or find it and add this snippet to that and the remaining subcategories recursively. Categories and subcategories in cat are delimited by "/", regardless of the operating system (since it has nothing to do with the file system).

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of this category or subcategory.

Overrides:
getName in class java.awt.Component

public void setName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the name (and text) of this category.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this category for debugging.

Overrides:
toString in class java.awt.Component

write

public void write(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                  java.lang.String indent)
           throws java.io.IOException
Writes this category and its children as .ui XML to the given PrintWriter.
